meanings.definition: Wheeples (verb): to make a high-pitched, whining sound
meanings.sent1: The puppy wheeples when it wants attention.
meanings.sent2: The teapot wheeples softly as it boils.
meanings.sent3: The old car wheeples like a tiny, sad bird.
meanings.sent4: The wind wheeples through the trees, a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: Her voice wheeples with excitement as she tells her story.

meanings.definition: Wheeples (noun): a series of high-pitched, whining sounds
meanings.sent1: The wheeples of the baby kept the parents awake all night.
meanings.sent2: The wheeples of the old computer were a constant annoyance.
meanings.sent3: The wheeples of the alarm clock were like a tiny orchestra in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The wheeples of the teapot created a soothing background noise.
meanings.sent5: The wheeples of the wind outside made the house feel eerie.

meanings.definition: Wheeples (adjective): characterized by high-pitched, whining sounds
meanings.sent1: The wheeples toy had a cute, high-pitched sound.
meanings.sent2: The wheeples bird chirped loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The wheeples car alarm went off at the worst times.
meanings.sent4: The wheeples wind chimes filled the garden with music.
meanings.sent5: The wheeples voice of the child was endearing to everyone.
